intro: Mikania santamensis, commonly known as the Santa Maria Mikania, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, ribbed fruits. Mikania santamensis is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
